verses.kjv: And there went a man of the house of Levi, and took to wife a daughter of Levi.
verses.web: A man of the house of Levi went and took a daughter of Levi as his wife.
verses.ct: A man from the tribe of Levi married a woman who was also from the tribe of Levi.

verses.kjv: And the woman conceived, and bare a son: and when she saw him that he was a goodly child, she hid him three months.
verses.web: The woman conceived and bore a son. When she saw that he was a fine child, she hid him three months.
verses.ct: She became pregnant and gave birth to a son. When she saw what a beautiful baby he was, she hid him for 3 months.

verses.kjv: And when she could not longer hide him, she took for him an ark of bulrushes, and daubed it with slime and with pitch, and put the child therein; and she laid it in the flags by the river’s brink.
verses.web: When she could no longer hide him, she took a papyrus basket for him, and coated it with tar and with pitch. She put the child in it, and laid it in the reeds by the river’s bank.
verses.ct: When she couldn't hide him any longer, she got a papyrus basket and waterproofed it with tar and pitch. Then she placed the baby inside and set the basket among the reeds along the bank of the river.

verses.kjv: And his sister stood afar off, to wit what would be done to him.
verses.web: His sister stood far off, to see what would be done to him.
verses.ct: The baby's sister stood at a distance, watching to see what would happen to him.

verses.kjv: And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to wash herself at the river; and her maidens walked along by the river’s side; and when she saw the ark among the flags, she sent her maid to fetch it.
verses.web: Pharaoh’s daughter came down to bathe at the river. Her maidens walked along by the riverside. She saw the basket among the reeds, and sent her servant to get it.
verses.ct: Pharaoh's daughter came down to the river to bathe, while her attendants walked along the riverbank. She noticed the basket among the reeds and sent one of her servants to get it.

verses.kjv: And when she had opened it, she saw the child: and, behold, the babe wept. And she had compassion on him, and said, This is one of the Hebrews’ children.
verses.web: She opened it, and saw the child, and behold, the baby cried. She had compassion on him, and said, “This is one of the Hebrews’ children.”
verses.ct: When she opened it, she saw the baby — and he was crying. Her heart went out to him, and she said, "This must be one of the Hebrew children."

verses.kjv: Then said his sister to Pharaoh’s daughter, Shall I go and call to thee a nurse of the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for thee?
verses.web: Then his sister said to Pharaoh’s daughter, “Should I go and call a nurse for you from the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for you?”
verses.ct: Then the baby's sister approached Pharaoh's daughter and asked, "Would you like me to find a Hebrew woman who can nurse the baby for you?"

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, Go. And the maid went and called the child’s mother.
verses.web: Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Go.” The young woman went and called the child’s mother.
verses.ct: "Yes, go," Pharaoh's daughter told her. So the girl went and brought back the baby's own mother.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh’s daughter said unto her, Take this child away, and nurse it for me, and I will give thee thy wages. And the woman took the child, and nursed it.
verses.web: Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Take this child away, and nurse him for me, and I will give you your wages.” The woman took the child, and nursed it.
verses.ct: Pharaoh's daughter said to the woman, "Take this baby and nurse him for me, and I'll pay you for it." So the woman took her son and nursed him.

verses.kjv: And the child grew, and she brought him unto Pharaoh’s daughter, and he became her son. And she called his name Moses: and she said, Because I drew him out of the water.
verses.web: The child grew, and she brought him to Pharaoh’s daughter, and he became her son. She named him Moses, and said, “Because I drew him out of the water.”
verses.ct: When the boy was old enough, his mother brought him to Pharaoh's daughter, and she adopted him as her own son. She named him Moses, saying, "Because I drew him out of the water."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in those days, when Moses was grown, that he went out unto his brethren, and looked on their burdens: and he spied an Egyptian smiting an Hebrew, one of his brethren.
verses.web: In those days, when Moses had grown up, he went out to his brothers and saw their burdens. He saw an Egyptian striking a Hebrew, one of his brothers.
verses.ct: Years later, after Moses had grown up, he went out to where his own people were and saw how hard they were forced to work. He spotted an Egyptian beating a Hebrew — one of his own people.

verses.kjv: And he looked this way and that way, and when he saw that there was no man, he slew the Egyptian, and hid him in the sand.
verses.web: He looked this way and that way, and when he saw that there was no one, he killed the Egyptian, and hid him in the sand.
verses.ct: Moses looked around in every direction, and when he was sure no one was watching, he killed the Egyptian and buried him in the sand.

verses.kjv: And when he went out the second day, behold, two men of the Hebrews strove together: and he said to him that did the wrong, Wherefore smitest thou thy fellow?
verses.web: He went out the second day, and behold, two men of the Hebrews were fighting with each other. He said to him who did the wrong, “Why do you strike your fellow?”
verses.ct: The next day he went out again and saw two Hebrew men fighting each other. He said to the one in the wrong, "Why are you hitting your own countryman?"

verses.kjv: And he said, Who made thee a prince and a judge over us? intendest thou to kill me, as thou killedst the Egyptian? And Moses feared, and said, Surely this thing is known.
verses.web: He said, “Who made you a prince and a judge over us? Do you plan to kill me, as you killed the Egyptian?” Moses was afraid, and said, “Surely this thing is known.”
verses.ct: The man shot back, "Who made you a prince and judge over us? Are you planning to kill me the way you killed that Egyptian?" Moses was afraid and thought, "People must already know what I did."

verses.kjv: Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to slay Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of Midian: and he sat down by a well.
verses.web: Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to kill Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh, and lived in the land of Midian, and he sat down by a well.
verses.ct: When Pharaoh heard about it, he tried to have Moses killed. But Moses fled from Pharaoh and settled in the land of Midian, where he sat down beside a well.

verses.kjv: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters: and they came and drew water, and filled the troughs to water their father’s flock.
verses.web: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters. They came and drew water, and filled the troughs to water their father’s flock.
verses.ct: Now the priest of Midian had 7 daughters. They came to the well, drew water, and filled the troughs to water their father's flock.

verses.kjv: And the shepherds came and drove them away: but Moses stood up and helped them, and watered their flock.
verses.web: The shepherds came and drove them away; but Moses stood up and helped them, and watered their flock.
verses.ct: But some shepherds showed up and drove the women away. Moses stepped in, stood up for them, and watered their flock himself.

verses.kjv: And when they came to Reuel their father, he said, How is it that ye are come so soon to day?
verses.web: When they came to Reuel, their father, he said, “How is it that you have returned so early today?”
verses.ct: When the daughters returned to their father Reuel, he asked, "How did you get back so early today?"

verses.kjv: And they said, An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and also drew water enough for us, and watered the flock.
verses.web: They said, “An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and moreover he drew water for us, and watered the flock.”
verses.ct: They answered, "An Egyptian rescued us from the shepherds. He even drew water for us and watered the flock."

verses.kjv: And he said unto his daughters, And where is he? why is it that ye have left the man? call him, that he may eat bread.
verses.web: He said to his daughters, “Where is he? Why is it that you have left the man? Call him, that he may eat bread.”
verses.ct: "So where is he?" their father asked. "Why did you leave the man behind? Go invite him to eat with us."

verses.kjv: And Moses was content to dwell with the man: and he gave Moses Zipporah his daughter.
verses.web: Moses was content to dwell with the man. He gave Moses Zipporah, his daughter.
verses.ct: Moses agreed to stay with the man, and Reuel gave his daughter Zipporah to Moses as his wife.

verses.kjv: And she bare him a son, and he called his name Gershom: for he said, I have been a stranger in a strange land.
verses.web: She bore a son, and he named him Gershom, for he said, “I have lived as a foreigner in a foreign land.”
verses.ct: She gave birth to a son, and Moses named him Gershom, saying, "I have been a foreigner in a foreign land."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in process of time, that the king of Egypt died: and the children of Israel sighed by reason of the bondage, and they cried, and their cry came up unto God by reason of the bondage.
verses.web: In the course of those many days, the king of Egypt died, and the children of Israel sighed because of the bondage, and they cried, and their cry came up to God because of the bondage.
verses.ct: A long time passed, and the king of Egypt died. The Israelites groaned under the weight of their slavery and cried out for help. Their desperate cries rose up to God because of their bondage.

verses.kjv: And God heard their groaning, and God remembered his covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacob.
verses.web: God heard their groaning, and God remembered his covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacob.
verses.ct: God heard their groaning, and God remembered his covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacob.

verses.kjv: And God looked upon the children of Israel, and God had respect unto them.
verses.web: God saw the children of Israel, and God was concerned about them.
verses.ct: God looked down on the people of Israel, and his heart was moved for them.
